It is likely that the trend towards progressive values and inclusivity will continue to gain momentum in the future, as younger generations increasingly value diversity and social justice. For example, a 2019 Pew Research Center survey found that younger Americans are more likely to support same-sex marriage and to say that people should be able to choose their own gender identity.

This shift in attitudes is also reflected in the increasing number of religiously unaffiliated individuals, as well as the growing popularity of non-traditional spiritual practices such as yoga and meditation. Some scholars predict that religion may become more decentralized in the future, with people practicing and forming spiritual communities outside of traditional institutions.

Of course, this trend is not universal and there are still many individuals and communities who resist these changes. Some religious institutions may become more conservative in response to these changes, which could potentially lead to further division and fragmentation. 

Overall, it remains to be seen how these trends will evolve in the future, but it is likely that the relationship between religion and society will continue to be shaped by ongoing shifts in cultural norms and values.
